physical_appearance: This is a page from a document that contains an article It is printed in faint black ink on a plain sheet of paper. There is a page number at the top-center of the document. The document is slightly folded and torn especially along the sides. There is a horizontal fold line across the center of the document.
sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steeleâ€™s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: A Journalist's Story of the Torpedoeing in the Malacca Straits
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war journalism torpedoes documents (object genre)
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Journalism Torpedoes War stories
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
